resources.string: Are you sure you would like to go back?

It\'s easy to get started. In draw mode, tap the paint icon to bring up the paint panel. From here you can choose a color. Tap and drag anywhere on the canvas to draw that color. Tap and drag back over any pixels that you want to remove. Finalize by tapping the green checkmark, or to cancel tap the red x.

The first tool is the export tool. Tap the icon then select or drag around your drawing. A preview will appear with two export options in the upper right. The left icon is to save your drawing locally to your device photos. The right icon is to share your drawing through text, email, and various other ways.
The second tool is the background tool. Tap the icon to switch between different canvas backgrounds.
The third tool is the grid line toggle tool. Tap the icon to turn on and off grid lines. Grid lines appear when zoomed into the canvas.
The dot below all the tools is the toolbox toggle. Tap it to show and hide tools.
The dot on the opposite side of the toolbox toggle is the palette toggle. Tap it to show and hide your current color palette.

The default color palette is the Recent Color palette. It is composed of all colors that you have used recently. To add a new color palette tap on \"Recent Color\" in the paint panel. Then tap the + button and enter a name for your new palette. The new palette will be added to your list of palettes. Select the new palette by tapping on it in the list. As you use the color picker to select colors you will see a + and - sign appear under the palette name in the paint panel. Tap the + icon to add the color to your palette or tap the - icon to remove the color from your palette.
